text:
[9150-20170420] 375mL bottle. Super raspberry juice aroma. Hazy, dark deep red body with a medium-lasting foamy off-white pink head. Fruity raspberry yeast and sour sour fruity berry flavour. Medium body is quite tart. Delicious. (8/4/9/4/16) 4.1
(Crooked Stave Tap Takeover @ Birreria Volo, Toronto, ON)

Cette biÃ¨re sÂ’adresse aux sincÃ¨res amateurs de framboises. En suis-je un? Je lÂ’ignore. Chose certaine est que je suis heureux dÂ’avoir partagÃ© cette petite bouteille de 375ml. Robe rouge pourpre, non filtrÃ©e, et profonde. ArÃ´mes de confiture de framboises, de pÃ©pins de framboises, de plant de framboises et de pulpe. Il y a tant de fruit dans cette biÃ¨re que le funk en est rÃ©duit presque Ã  nÃ©ant. MÃªme scÃ©nario en bouche. Je peine Ã  percevoir autre chose que ce fruit dominant qui semble avoir Ã©tÃ© rÃ©duit en purÃ©e directement dans mon verre. Heureusement, le liquide est peu sucrÃ©, voire sec. Un fond presque aigre dans lÂ’oesophage mais encore lÃ , je suspecte lÂ’aciditÃ© du fruit plus que lÂ’aciditÃ© de bactÃ©ries lactiques.

A 375ml bottle, bottled in December 2015. Poured into a Cantillon ballon glass. It was a dark burgundy ruby red colour with a just over one finger off pink with a dark orange hued head that dissipated fairly quickly to a thin cap with some nice lacing. There was some very nice sweet and tart raspberry jammy aromas with perhaps a hint of oak. Tastes sour and tart raspberries and lemon to begin, followed by some light sweet jammy raspberries and a hint of oak. It finishes sour again with lemon, some citric acidity and a touch of grapes. Medium bodied with moderate to light carbonation and a dry-ish finish. Overall the aromas were stunning and while the taste didnÂ’t quite match up to the aroma, it was still very good.

On tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. This is a a warm cloudy almost purple red one with a small sidesticking pinkish head. Smells of raspberries, cherries, some wood. Really good and light acidic. Well sour in the taste also! ItÂ’s oily in the mouth and above average on the carbonation. A lovely tasting raspberry bomb this. Delish! 14.05.2016

2017-04-20. Dark brown body modest beige head. Aroma has big jammy raspberry character up front. Muted dark malt below. Flavour is fairly sour, seemingly more so than the regular Origins. Tart sour raspberry follows. Smooth average bodied palate, soft to low carbonation. 7/3-4/7-8/3/15-16 Bottled at Birreria Volo, Toronto.

375ml bottle. Burgundy colour with average, frothy, moderately lasting, minimally lacing, pinkish head. Fruity aroma is slighty raspberry dominated, additional notes of dark and red berries in general, hints of blue grapes. Taste is extremely sour, fruity, notes of red and dark berries, blue grapes, slight raspberry predominance. Too sour, pyrosis evocative.

Bottle shared with the KL tastinfg group. Poured a hazy reddish brown with a bubbly off white head. The aroma is rich sweet jammy raspberry fruit. The flavour is moderate sour with a crisp fresh tart raspberry fruit, light dough biscuit yeast palate. Medium bodied with lively carbonation.

Murky dark red color with pinkish head. Aroma has some balsamic vinegar notes and intense fruit character. Taste starts quite sour up-front, really fruity, quite acidic, really dry on the finish. Light body, dry, medium carbonation. Really sour and fruity ale.
@Basunen 17-3-4: Mycket stor doft av hallon och svarta vinbÃ¤r. Lagom syrlighet och en fyllig bÃ¤rsmak i god kombination. JÃ¤ttegott

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking a Raspberry Origins by Crooked Stave Artisan Beer Project at Saska KÄ™paAromat to dzem malinowy. Smak duzo fajniej i bardziej zlozony, dosc mocno kwasny, pestkowy, ciut sciagajacy i taniczny, dzikosci malo, bdbOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupeÅ‚niania profilu na ratebeer. CBC #201

Draught. Dark red coloured. Dense off whiteh ead. Aroma. Berries, sourness, light funk, oak, vinegar. Flavour. Vinegar, berries, funk, oak, sourness, citrus, spice and earth. Medium to full bodied. Ends funky sour and full of berries. Nice.
Bottle thanks to Alex. Pours reddish brown with no head. Cherry and overripe raspberry. Very sour. Little carbonation. Acetic finish.b
Big nose, like a balsamic vinaigrette. deep ruby color. a huge mouth-puckering sour whacks you in the tongue. gets more and more enjoyable. not too fruity. nice!

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy ruby, small head, some lacing. Aroma is huge raspberries, stems and seeds, some funk. Flavor is medium tart, light funk, loads of berry, oak, mineral water, stems and seeds. Medium body.

Draught @ CBC 2016 [ Green Session ]. - Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016, Oksnehallen Vesterbro, Halmtorvet 11, 1700 Copenhagen, Denmark. [ As Crooked Stave Raspberry Origins ].Clear dark red color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white - pink head. Aroma is moderate malty, tart fruity - berries, rapsberry. Flavor is moderate sweet and acidic with a long duration, tart raspberry, fruity - berries, tart, funky. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20160514]
 8-4-8-4-16

375 ml bottle. Bottled on 12/2015.
Pours dark clear red color with a small pink head. Aroma is dark berries, raspberries, yeast, wood. Flavor is extremely tart fruity with citric notes, raspberries, yeast, wood, earthy. Mouthwatering. The style is more like a Sour/Wild Ale.
3465

375 ml bottle. Pours a dark ruby colour with a small head. Aroma of rich juicy raspberries, wood and really fresh herbal notes. Flavour of heavy juicy raspberry, wood, a bit of vanilla, red wine, tart wooden notes and some malts. Medium bodied. Long, dry, wooden finish. Great!

375ml bottle from Boxbeers. Batch December 2015. Pours very dark and deep red with a small head. Aroma of tart raspberries, oak, wood, funky sourness and yeast. Taste is tartish, funky and sourish with loads of oak, raspberries, wood, hints of bretta, vinegar and earthiness. Finish is mouth drying tart, sourish and slightly sweet with loads of dark raspberry juice, hints of oak and vinous notes. Good.

37,5 cl bottle @Â LeppÃ¤vaara, bottled 12/2015
Aroma has strong raspberry juice tones and quite nothing else. Flavour has tart raspberries, some earthy notes and berry juice. Aggressive yet balanced. Nice. By taste this is lambic/fruit and not sour red. This tastes just like a raspberry lambic does.

BeslÃ¶jad rubinrÃ¶d Ã¶l med rosa skum. En doft av fÃ¤rska syrliga hallon tillsammans med trÃ¤ och lÃ¤tt funkighet. Ã„ven i smaken dominerar en naturlig syrlig hallonsmak. LÃ¤tta toner av trÃ¤, vinÃ¤ger och vanilj.

Bottle at Churchkey into a snifter showing moderately filtered wine red with sparse white foam. 

The nose shows an intense, concentrated, yet deep, round, and sweet raspberries. Fantastic nose. 

The palate is medium bodied and highly carbonated. Highly tart with a lot of tart dry raspberries with the same resurgence of fruit on the finish. Very well done.Â’
Bottle. Pours a deep red color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity sour funky raspberry aroma. Fruity sour tart woody raspberry flavor. Has a fruity sour tart raspberry finish.

Bottle, bought @Mikkeller Webshop. Pours fat, almost bloody red with a light pink head. Aroma has tartness aplenty, very subdued vinegar, light lactic, stunning fresh tart raspberry, light Vanilla and some sweet malts in the back. Medium carbonation, fine creaminess and elegantly dry mouthfeel. Flavour is equally elegant, lots of fresh raspberry on top of a multi-layered sweet, softly caramelly malts backbone, Again some Vanilla. Probably the best American sour IÂ’ve had so far.

Bottle from a nice swede at Himmeriget, Zwanze day. Pours a clearish brown with a tiny off-white head. Sour with light sweetness. Aromas of citrus fruits, balsamic vinegar and some sour dough. Quite fruity towards the end. Medium bodied. Soft carbonation. Dry and tart finish.
Bottle at Himmeriget. Hazy chestnut brown with a medium sized tan head. Dark wood, raspberries, lemony sourness, twigs, earthy. Light dark dried fruits. Long sour finish. Too sour for my preference.

My Bottom Line:
Deep raspberry juices grace lactic acidity, leathery undertones and wooden depths in this perfectly cohesive and highly seductive Barrel-Aged Fruit Beer.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A pink sheet of foam tops the glistening blood red.
-Raspberry and lactic acidity quickly become one in the flavour profile.
-Flavor intensity is, as usual for Crooked Stave, high enough to create interest with every sip and smooth enough to encourage drinkability and more delicate food pairings.
-Body is softly effervescent and velvety.
-All components are perfectly balanced. This is an impressive blend.

Bottle.
From tap at CBC 2016. Clear dark ruby colour with a pink head. Aroma and flavour of raspberries, fruit, tartness, acidic, oak and sweet.
Bottle at Hazel, shared with Travlr. Thanks! Poured a dark ruby red color with a small pink hue. Aroma was lots of raspberry. Raspberry tartness. Sour, so tart so tasty.
Bottle at Hazel. Dark clear ruby red color. Aroma of vinous raspberry. Taste is tart berries, light tannins. Very tasty.

Pours a very deep red color with a nice head & good lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is big on raspberry, funk, and honestly some nuttiness akin to a kriek. Oaky, a bit of lemon, nice. 

The flavor is both rich & sour with lots of tart raspberry & oak... itÂ’s nutty, dry.. Very slightly bitter in an earthy way. Just fantastic really.

Ruby red ale with pink nice head on top leaving lacing behind. Aroma has lots of of sweet raspberries, sour berries too. Taste has a lot of raspberries, then some other sweet berries and sourness too. Not that sour because of the sweetness. Full soft body and medium carbonation. Well in the end, raspberry is just raspberry.

sample from bottle, poured a deeper ruby red colour with an off white head. nose of fresh sweet sour raspberries, oak, citrus, raspberry marmalade, tartness, cherry pie, and vinous wine notes, dry. nice

Medium sour fruity aroma and taste with big raspberry prominence, berry fruits, tart, wine infused oak notes into the close.

370ml bottle. Thank you, Harri. Dark red or bordeaux red colour. Nice pinkish head. Fresh raspberries, juiciniess, tanins, slight acidity in the aroma. Raspberries, raspberry seads in first taste. Really refreshing. Raspberries also in the middle. Fresh raspberry juice. Slightly acidic, vinegary finish. Raspberries also in the aftertaste, which is powerful. Acidity is very well in balance. Light bodied, refreshing, well drinkable sour ale.
Bottle at home. Pours deep ruby, nose is raspberry, funky, toffee, taste is sweet, tart raspberry, dry, funky.

375 ml bottle, bottled December 2015, 7.5% ABV. Served in a Prairie Teku, the beer pours a dark reddish/purple color with about an inch light purple head with decent retention. ThereÂ’s a good amount of lacing. Aroma is fruity and tart, the brew smells like oak, fresh raspberries, raspberry jam, earthiness and tart berries. Taste is pretty much just like the aroma, but thereÂ’s also some lemon, red wine and vinegar noticeable. Nice balance with the sweet fruity and tart flavors. Mouthfeel/body is medium, itÂ’s easy enough to drink with a moderate amount of carbonation. I liked this a lot, glad I bought this when I saw a bottle. $14.99 a bottle.

Poured from bottle into a sample tulip: Pours dark red / purple with a thin head. Aroma raspberry, cherry, other fruits, and funk. Taste more of the same, lots of tasty fruit flavor with a mild to medium tartness. Soft mouthfeel, really good beer.
CBC. Deep red with small pink head. Aroma is malt, raspberries, berries, lemon and sour. Flavour is malt, raspberries, sour, lemon,, citric, sour, vinegar, medium sweet and medium dry.
Murky red with a small, light tan head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of raspberries, wood, pie crust, yeast. Taste of raspberries, tart skins, wood, sour berry finish.
Tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration, 2016. Clear red body with a small pink head. Oak, raspberries, yeast, funky, tart, juicy.

From tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016 - Green session. Hazy dark red color with pink head. Yeasty and malty aroma, tart fruity, cherries-berries, light funky, wood, vinous. Sweet and acidic fruity taste. MEdium oily body with soft carbonation.

ThereÂ’s a lot of beautiful beers made with raspberries out there. IÂ’ll be the first to admit that, but sweet holy hell Raspberry Origins has to be one of the best. Dark red pour, the foam has a reddish hue. This smells like raspberry preserves and happiness. Some less prominent smells of old, vinous oak. Lots of raspberry sweetness in the flavor profile. Just a hint of vinegar. Tartness is reigned back gorgeously. Guess you could say I liked it.

Bottle to mini tulip. Ruby red almost purple color with light pink head. Aroma is jammy raspberry, light funk, and cherry skins. Taste is moderate tartness and balances jammy fruit sweetness. Really great stuff.

Bottle.

A- Raspberries.

A- Dark red color, dark liquid, pink head.

T- Raspberry juice, slightly sour.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, refreshing finish.

O- Basically raspberry juice in a glass. A bit sour and a bit sweet. Overall, very very good. Could drink this all day if it wasnÂ’t so damned expensive.

Draft. Medium tan head atop hazy red body. Aroma is moderately sweet, raspberry, some vinous, lemon, wood. Taste is moderately sweet, tart, sour raspberry/lemon, light funk. Medium body, acidic, some stickiness.

Bottle. Pours deep red with a pink head. Aroma of intense raspberries, raspberry seeds, marzipan, jammy notes., tart grapes and vinous notes. The taste is pretty tart with notes of raspberries, vinous notes, marzipan, oak, funky brett and jam. Deep and intense raspberry beer.
375 ml. bottle. Pours a mostly clear, bright, dark red with a small off-white head. Aroma of fruit and berries. Taste is raspberries, fruit, oak, and some malt. Excellent.

Bottle from Kihoskh, Copenhagen. Clear deep amber/ruby beer with a nice pink/ruby head. Tart raspberry and blackberry aroma, raisins, some chocolate. Tart raspberry flavor, wild strawberries, grapes, vinegar notes. Quite nice.

Draught @ CBC 2016, Green session, KÃ¸benhavn
Pours clear deep amber with a pink head. Aroma has notes of malt, raspberry, tart, caramel and funk. Taste is light to medium sweet and medium sour with a long dry, sour, raspberry and funky finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottled. Pours deep red with a small pink head. Aroma of funk, raspberries, woodey notes and a little vanilla. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up dry and tart. Light to medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent Sour. ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ

Draught @ CBC. Pours dark red with a small pink head. Aroma of sourness, wood, oak, little vinegar, tart fruity, raspberry. Flavor is sour, wood, yeasty, light bretty, oak, tart fruity, raspberry. Medium body, average carbonation, acidic finish. 140516

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2016 From a bottle. Pours hazy dark burgundy with a fizzy pink head. Tastes like dry raspberry, tart, salty cracker malt, yeast, acidic. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like dry raspberry, tart, sour berry candy, and vanilla.

Bottle. Pours dark ruby. Aroma is raspberry jam, bready malts, faint acidity, and faint vanilla. Flavor is rich raspberry flavors throughout with sharp acidity up front and nice sweetness along with some soft woody notes and a dry, tart finish. Medium body.
CBC. Hazy deep red with a pink head. Aroma is sweet, malty, heavy raspberries and bretty. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 140516

[5/14/16] Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Green session. Beautiful purple with a pink head. Amazing juicy raspberries aroma with some wood. Tart flavor, lactic, full of juicy raspberries, and some wood. Amazing, juicy, refreshing.
375 ml bottle. Pours deep dark mahogany red and then carbonation quickly fades. Sour, of course. But complex. Fruit and raspberry shin with some alcohol and vinegar and oak. Nice.

With the exception of Rocky Ford melons and wild chokecherries, Colorado is hardly renowned for its fruit. (If you think Palisade peaches and plums are first tier, youÂ’ve never had a Kit Donnell peach or elephant heart plum from Morgan Hill, CA.) But right now, Colorado breweries and blenderies are turning out the best fruit beers in the country. On the sophisticated side are Call to Arms The Bett Has NO Myces (lychees are hardly a Colorado specially) and CaseyÂ’s Cherry Fruit Stand (the best sour cherries come from Michigan). On the rustic side are TrinityÂ’s Menacing Kumquat (Colorado citrus?) and this beer which tastes straight out of the berry patch. Perhaps more like raspberry cider than raspberry beer...but IÂ’m not complaining. Damn pretty, too.

Sample at CBC 2016. 

Dark red with a small pink head. Quite a lot of raspberries both in the aroma and taste. Also wood, funk, light vinegar and some malt. The finish was dry and tart.
Sampled at CBC 2016 - day 2. Dark ruby with a tall pink head. Raspberries, fruit and barrel sourness, very subtle oak and vanilla notes, some barnyard funk.

On tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Deep red with a large pink head. Aroma is raspberry, sour red fruits. Light bodied, tart on the palate, fruity dry finish. Taste is raspberry, dry red wine, wood, red wine vinegar.
Tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration, 2016. Pours Brown with a creamy head. Lovely fresh and intense raspberries in both nose and flavor. Funk, Wood and barnyard. Clean! Dope
@Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016, GREENred, dark redish colour. Raspberry janny, seedy nose. Tart. Dry finish. Dry raspberry berries, raspberry seedy.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
CBC2016. Klare rÃ¶tlich pinke Farbe, mittelgroÃŸe pinke Schaumkrone. Geruch nach roten FrÃ¼chten, Himbeeren, leicht holzig, sÃ¤uerlich. Geschmack leicht sÃ¤uerlich fruchtig, Kraut, Himbeeren.

14.05.2016, tap @ CBC:
Small slightly fizzy-creamy shortlasting head, deep red color. Aroma is fresh fruity, raspberry candy, berry skin, raspberry syrup, grass, fruit stones, red currants, mild vinegar. Taste is sour-ish dry, vinegar, sorrel, sour raspberries, oak, berry skin, bark, grass, red currants. Medium bitterness, dry acidic mouthfeel. Nice.
CBC. Deep red with a small pink head. Aroma of raspberry with funk and wood. Dry and tart flavour with lots of raspberry and notes of phenols and medicine.
Keg at cbc16.. Deep red.. Thin tan lacing.. Soft sweet raspberry fruit nose.. Soft zesty raspberry. M tart raspberry but nig raspberry.. Long bitter raspberry
A red beer with a pink head. The aroma has notes of berries, wood, and brettanomyces. The flavor is sour with notes of lemons, wood, berries, and brettanomyces, leading to a tart finish.
From tap. Pours cloudy deep red with a small pink head. Aroma is fruity, crisp raspberry. Dry, citric and smooth fruity finish. Smooth and crisp finish.
Tap at CBC2016, Copenhagen. Colour is deep red with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Berries, red berries, raspberries, some sourness and some sweetness.
Pours clear red with low pink head. Aroma of raspberries, blueberries, blackberries... Wow! Taste is rich cherry tart with mild sweet berry finish. Light and smooth body with average carbonation.
Tap@ CBC 2016. Red wine color, light pink head. Raspberry notes in aroma, tartness. Raspberry juice, tartness, funk. Mouthdrying. Excellent.

Pours purple with low purple head 
Aromas of raspberry lemonade, cracked garden branch, red grapes 
Taste has tart notes of raspberries, red currant, cracked garden branch
CBC 20q6. Pours intense red with a low light red head. Aromas of raspberry, red currant, citrus. Taste is very very fruity and quite sour. Mouthfeel is light bodied with medium carbonation.
Tap cbc. Pours brown reddish with a light off white head. Aroma of intense raspbery, super clean noes, bretty and acedic. Good

On tap at the Source and the only 5$ taster I went for, great sours but you pay a higher than average price for tasters. Then again theyÂ’re worth it. Awesome purple-red color with a purple-white head of foam. Very tart rich raspberry aroma. Super dry light body with an awesomely tart raspberry flavor that is like drinking raspberry juiced distilled into a tart essence. Acidic but wonderful.

375ml bottle bought at Hill Farmstead a week ago. Aroma: great intense sugary and tart raspberries. Not much more but only this smells pretty awesome. App: hazy dark purple with nice of white pinkish head. Not much retention but could be my glass as I noticed it was so clean some pouring. Taste and palate: medium body lively carbonation, tart, medium acidity and highly dry finish. Overall: great even though the combination of the lively carbonation with the acidity makes it a tad difficult to swallow. It really tickles the cheeks. Aroma and taste is quite amazing though. Great job again Crooked Stave.

On tap @ Ei8ht Ball / Bellevue KY --- Aroma of raspberry syrup. Clear dark cranberry color, white head tinged with pink, blobs of lace. Taste is straight sour raspberry that flows un impeded to a long sour finish. The sour attacks the taste buds, cleansing effectively. A decent sour ale.

Pours a brilliant dark purplish color with magenta foam... Aroma of raspberry jam, oak, fleshy berries... Flavor is sour raspberries, raspberry seeds, mixed berries, really fresh tasting... Delicious, Atrial level 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle smuggled back from the brewer by B-Real (thanks!): deep purple-red pour with slight beige head. aroma of raspberry, toffee, doughy, light vinegar and sour. tastes are raspberry, vinegar, acidic, musty, funky, fruity, spice, wood, caramel. palate is lively tingly medium. sharp tart finish. fun brew.

The beer pours dark purple with a pink head. The aroma has lots of raspberries, red wine, tartness, lemons and blueberries. The beer has a medium body with soft carbonation. The taste has big raspberries, sourness, oak, graininess and various berries. The finish is crisp and tart. Nice.

Hazy deep raspberry hue wth a thin, foamy pink head. Big fleshy and tart raspberry aroma with sweet raspberry juice and light oak. Slightly boozy and funky sour flavor with a load of fresh, juicy raspberries, light oak and a tart sour finish.

Bottle. Clear ruby brown with a small, foamy, dark pink head that lasts in a ring and laces some. Aromas of raspberry, funk, wood, caramel, and vanilla. Flavor is tart raspberry, wood, light funk, vanilla, caramel, and vinegar. Light bodied, smooth with a dry end. Moderately acidic.

Sample at The Source. The beer is a slightly cloudy reddish-mahogany color with a medium fluffy white head that diminishes gradually to a film. Small patches of lacing. Aroma of oak, berries and yeast. Medium body with flavors of tart raspberries, herbal yeast, vinous oak and malt. The finish is moderately sour with a raspberry aftertaste. Good beer all around.

Bottle @ Home. Thanks, Jake. Cola colored beer with some khaki foam. Has sort of a raspberry tea note and some herbal qualities. A bit of red vinegar and definitely some balsamic notes. Maybe a touch on the sweet side. Hint of charred oak and chocolate on the finish.

375ml bottle, thanks Aaron! Pours a ruby brown color with a tan head and some lacing. Aroma is oak, raspberry, sour cherry. Medium on the palate with lively carbonation. Flavor is sour, very sour, tons of oak, vinegar, raspberry, cherry, with a fruity, sour finish. Very tasty, but maybe a touch too sour.
Crooked Stave Tasting Night; hazy dark ribena red pour with a creamy light pink head, sour red fruits aroma, taste has raspberry and some vanilla, a hint almond, a hint of citrus, excellent.
(375ml bottle) Pours a reddish brown body with a small off-white head. Aroma of raspberry, horse blanket, wood, and mustiness. Flavor of raspberry, caramel, oak, and light balsamic.

Bottle @ 5 Kay, 7.5 Kay, 10 Kay Tasting. Deep reddish pour with a small off-white head. The nose is of raspberry meat. Earthy wood, leaves. Really nice, crisp jammy notes. Taste is very jammy. Raspberry donut. A touch of balsamic. Not overly funky or all that aggressive. Much less muddled than the bourbon version. Medium body, active carb. Quite good.

Bottle 375ml.
Pours very deep hazy purple/burgundy with low off-white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of raspberries, some vinegar, dark/red fruits. Taste is of raspberries, sugar, some acidity, flanderÂ’s red-like features (oaky), very slight vinegar, alcohol. Palate: Medium-full bodied. Medium carbonation. Overall: Awesome flanders-like stuff. Crafty fruits. Outstanding.

Bottle (375 ml). From Mark, thanks! Split with the QuÃ©bec crew.

Appearance: Hazy dark and deep red with a small beige head, good retention and some lacing. 

Aroma: Jammy raspberries, oak, light vinegar, red wine, brettanomyces and light chocolatey presence.

Taste: It gets even better here with jammy raspberries again well balanced by a moderate acidity, red wine, chocolatey notes, caramel, oak, mild spiciness and light fruit vinegar.

Palate: Medium body. Medium carbonation. Vinous. Oaky. Jammy finish. 

Overall: Wow! Very nice twist on a sour red with great barrel character, nice complexity and good balance. The explosion of fruits is perfect. Tasty stuff!

Pours a medium brown with a reddish hue. On top sits a beige rim that leaves some lacing. Nose is of chocolate, raspberries and traces of acetic acid. Taste is really raspberry forward and moderately tart. Vinous and not too acetic. Other red fruits but raspberries are the centerpoint here. Body is medium and carbonation moderate. Overall a nice and not too hardcore sour!

pours cloudy dark mahogany with a reviving off-white cap, some retention and lacing. raspberry confiture, doughy toasted toffee maltiness, plums, fresh figs, light-medium acidity - complex flora, smooth wood. average to light carbonation, medium body - oily, fluffy and incredibly smooth; lightly tart and vinous fruity-spicy finish. exemplary flanders mouthfeel. very tasty!

Bottle. Deep deep Clear red pour with foamy lacy white head. Nice intensity in the aroma, deep ripe raspberry aroma, light acetic notes, pinot noir. Taste is beautiful, rich fruity raspberry flavor, ripe raspberry, citric with a touch of acetic acid, good balance, great intensity. Palate is med bodied, fairly chewy, nice mouth coating feel. Fabulous.

22/V/15 - 37.5cl bottle @ Brazilian Tasting (home) - BB: n/a, bottled: II/2014 (2015-672)  Thanks to 77ships for sharing the bottle!
Clear dark ruby red to purplish beer, big aery off-white to beige head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: very sour, vinegar, chlorine, tannins, bit off, more vinegar. MF: soft carbon, medium to light body. Taste: lots and lots of vinegar acidity, bit fruity, very sharp sourness, no subtleties, nope, nope! Aftertaste: more sour, very astringent, donÂ’t like!
Bottle share thanks to Homer. Pours a red, with little white head. Aroma is tart, acidic. taste follows, tart, acidic, but smooth, not overpowering. Tasty beer.

Bottle thanks to Aaron. Nose is super fruity with a tart pie like note. Very clear, dark red in color. Minimal head that dies quick. Taste is like a sweet tart with lots of fruitiness. A moderate to light malt backbone but U.S. Still balancing the acidity and tartness.

375 ml. bottle sampled @ Â“Brazilian TastingÂ”. Bottled during 02/2014. Obtained in a trade with AdamJackson. Double waxed! Dark red raspberry little tanned head at the sides. Nose is big sour, vinegar acidic, big sourness, puckering very thick raspberry, big fruit & wine quality,Â… Taste is puckering vinegar, acidic, sourness is very big, acidic, tart lemon acidity, great quality even if very sour, your pallet adjusts very quickly, sour wood wine, vinous character is big, thick wine mixed with very thick raspberry, real fruit & not jam quality, wood, rich fruit, berries, chewy malts,Â… Rich fruit & wine quality with fitting acidity,Â… Wonderful stuff.

375ml bottle courtesy of and shared with Tderoeck and 77ships. Bottled 02/2014.
Acajou trouble, col moyen blanc-cassÃ©.
ArÃ´me est juste Ã©norme au niveau des framboises, note terreuse de fruitÃ© fraichement rÃ©coltÃ©, le murissage en barrique ajoutant une belle complexitÃ© vineuse et fruitÃ© rouge.
Palais est Ã©galement fort au niveau des framboises qui gardent toute leur saveur organique et terreuse. Le tout procurant un profil lÃ©gÃ¨rement aigrelet fruitÃ©, presque Ã©picÃ© mais qui est bien en balance avec lÂ’usage du fÃ»t de chÃªne et de vin rouge. Framboise persistante, rÃ¢peux en bouche et offrant une pointe de picotement. Superbe.
Dark brown/red pour. Nose is raspberry, Flemish red. Taste is raspberry, funk, vinegar.

Bottle. Deep reddish brown pour with a fleeting off white head. Huge sour raspberry bouquet. Lots of bold sour raspberry and big vinous notes. Oak, vinegar, and malt backbeats. Good body and mouthfeel.

Bottle shared at the 5K/7.5K/10K tasting - who has a 7.5K tasting? big thanks to Bropey 7.5K guy - a bro fo sho, 30/12/14. 
Hazed reddish amber with a moderate light tan covering.
Nose is big tangy fruit rinds, red berry must, wood, spice, farmyard, dank strokes, hint of vanilla.
Taste comprises tangy red berry, tarte raspberry, musty wood, light fruited balsams, funk.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a well balanced acidic rise.
Solid sour red.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 375ml bottle pours dark brown black with 2 finger head. Nose is oak-forward, sawdust, dusty attic, tart berry and dark fruit skin, moderate funk. Taste is similar with medium acidity, wood spice, funky light raspberry fruit, touch of dark malt fruit sweetness. Finishes mostly dry with bits of funky sweet berry skin and lots of dusty barn wood. Tasty.

Big thanks to Nitze for this one! Pours a dark cola with small off-white head and good lacing. Nose and flavor are rife with vinous port and tannic oak, puckeringly tart raspberry and blackberry, strawberry yogurt, hints of almond and cherry. Tart, certainly not sweet. Delicious.

375ml bottle from my Crooked Stave Reserve Society 2014 lot. Thanks again to Mr. Nielsen as always. Pours a deeper brooding burgundy brown hue, darker and well hazed, the body is dark and ominous, brown and rust meet black cherry, deep burgundy hues. Frothy tannish head atop is a good thicker gloppy ringer. Good ringer retains and laces well. Aromas are a bit toasty and carmelized, biscuits meet lactic jabs, cherry and raspberry. Touches of oak, toast and raspberry. Gentle balsamic, red wine and vanillin. Decent funkiness as it warms a bit moie, the raspberry gives it some seedy, fleshy depth. Initial is lighter end of medium bodied, a bit toasty and biscuity, decent carmelized jabs with dark fruit, dried fruit, raisin and black cherry meeting red wine jabs, decent tannic oak, vanillin. Some touches of red wine and funk, cherries and fleshy raspberry start to raise in depth and potency. Dark fruit, lactic jabs and a touch of yogurt and acidity. Backend is fleshy, berry driven with a distinct carmelized and toasty base, biscuit and vanilla come on a bit more, that darker base gives some life. A bit deeper and complex compared to a straight sour. Some carmelized, balsamic, red wine and oak. Toast, faint cocoa, firmer vanilla with decent oak. Jabs of raspberry skin and pulp meet well with that vanilla, toast and carmelized biscuity feel. A bit darker, deep and lactic as we taper out. This one has some life. A firmer base beneath with nice potent sourness, raspberry life, fluffy cobweb brett and firmer oak presence. Tasty.

The beer is a fairly dark reddish brown color. ItÂ’s quite cloudy, just a flat mass of color. The head is smallish and light tan, and itÂ’s mostly dissipates after a minute. The aroma is wonderfully rich with raspberry flavor. Big and jammy. A little bit of other fruitiness bouncing around. Maybe a bit of buttery papaya, very pleasant. Relatively light touch of vinegar and funk. Some oak contributes a background woody vanilla character. Taste is medium-strong tart. Tons more fruit. It has all of the flavor of ripe raspberries with the tart underripe zing. Finishes fairly dry. Mild oak flavor, again mostly vanilla. Great berry pucker. Otherwise, the mouthfeel is fairly light, though the beer definitely coats the mouth. Wonderful sour with berries for days.

30th December 20145 Kay, 7.5 Kay, 10 Kay Tasting. Thanks to Scopey. Light haze on this deep amber beer, small cream colour head. Palate is airy and semi dry and a little crisp. Mildly sour dark raspberry. Mild lemon acid. Lesser generic dark fruits. Trace of balsamic. Light smooth finish. Not too tart and itÂ’s decently fruity.

Bottle shared in London - many thanks to Soapy! Pours unclear garnet with a frothy, light tan head. Pleasant semi-ripe raspberry aroma with some old wood, mild funk, earth. Light sweet flavor, nice tart berry zing, some acetic bite, juicy raspberries, light bitter pit. Light bodied with fine to average carbonation. Brisk and refreshing on the finish with sturdy acidity, more tart raspberries, modest woody dryness. Excellent.

Bottle shared at BruceÂ’s. It pours deep red with a decent beige head. The nose is earthy, wood, red wine, jammy raspberry, candy, cherry cola, toffee apple and must. The taste is tart, tangy, juicy, raspberry, jammy, very fruity, wood, earth, light acidity, sherbet, oak and sour candy with a dry finish. Medium+ body and moderate carbonation. Juicy and fruity. Pretty delicious.

Bottle - Pours reddish-amber with no head. Nose is raspberry with tart lemon and a little balsamic. Taste is lots of lemon tart, a little seedy raspberry, and dark malt. Medium body with nice carbonation.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2016 On tap at Crooked Stave. Dark purple, almost black, beautiful appearance with a pinkish beige head. Dank, fruity, sour and tart. Quite puckering, even for CS. Not as complex as Origins, perhaps. But damn this one is tasty.  Updated from a bottle pour.

Bottle to glass. Pours a mahogany brown color with a slightly fizzy light brown head. Aroma is tart, slightly dry, oak, sour berries. Flavor has a syrupy sour red character with a big raspberry tart. Light to medium body with a syrupy body and a lingering berry sour. Delicious!

Tap at brewery. Pours a dark reddish brown with dark khaki head. Aroma is fruity, a bit of leather, tart, faint vinegar. Taste is raspberry tartness, a bit of vinegar, earthy undertones and faint leather. Palate is medium body, high carbonation. Finished slightly dry. I really liked this one. Mmm.

Poured from a 375 ml bottle. 
Aroma has a nice medium light raspberry note with hints of acidity. Light oak with medium light malt notes of toasted bread and toffee. Faint tropical fruit. 
Pours a cloudy brown with some burnt red hues and a thick, small, dark tan head that recedes fairly quickly to the edges where it lingers for a bit with nice lacing. 
Flavor is moderately acidic with some nice raspberry and berry character. Medium light malt notes of toasted bread and toffee with hints of chocolate. light oak notes, Light citrus and stone fruit. medium light bitterness. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a really nice beer with fresh raspberry and nice light malt character. Good balanced acidity and not too jammy.

375 ml bottle poured a clear reddish brown with a small lasting creamy tan head. Aromas of raspberry, caramel, oak, vanilla and light citrus. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry tart finish. Flavors of raspberry, oak, light caramel and light citrus with a crisp dry tart lingering raspberry finish.
Golden pour. Small white head. Falls quick and leaves no lacing behind. Aroma is tart and raspberry muted behind some notes of funk. Taste is raspberry and tart funk. Pleasant.
Bottle, red/brown pour, white head, nose is cherry, taste is cherry, dark fruit, tart

375mL bottle, sent from mista (thanks a lot, Geoff), pours a deep dark mahogany with a small beige head. Aroma brings out sour raspberry jam and oak. Flavour is complex, with loads of sour raspberry jam, oak, and more fruity jammy tartness. Elegant and complex, with exceedingly high drinkability. Everything right about this beer. Wonderful.

12 oz bottle, 2014 CR. Pours burgundy with a small frothy off white head. Nose has leather, lots of raspberries, cranberries and some figs. Taste has raspberries, cranberries and some cherry. Some vanilla and leathery notes as well, a tad watery but all in all a solid sour.

Bottle... This beer rocks!... Pours murky and brown with a small, creamy, white head. The bouquet is a melange of cocoa, fallen oak and raspberries. Full-bodied with a creamy mouthfeel and pillow-soft carbonation. Super tart and fruity with some tannic bitterness. Tangy, lightly bitter finish. Thanks to ctipping for popping the top off this world-class brew!
Bottle shared at Darkness day. Pours dark amber. Strong sour rasberry smell and taste with great finish. Awesome beer!
Bottle. Damn - another amazing sour. Murky reddish orange pour. Raspberry and oak aroma. Nice sour taste. Incredible.

Pours burgundy coloured body with pink creamy head, leaves a lace trail of pink foam. Smell of raspberry puree. Smooth though still very strong carbonation.
Thanks again, Jason!

375 ml bottle to snifter (shared with the Mrs.). Looks good; a cloudy dull dark coffee with light beige head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells solid; funk oak, and raspberries. What seems like a light Flanders presence as well. Tastes like it smells, but better, with a pleasantly tart raspberry mouthfeel. ThereÂ’s more of a raspberry fruit presence on the tongue than the nose. Good stuff!

Bottle shared by all around chill bro Adnielsen. Pours a deep ruddy copper, nearly brown. Thin cream head. Aroma is dry, sweet red wine. Taste is fresh, tart raspberries, oak, vanilla. Puckering tart. Finish is dry and sweet. Wife said "I dunno, i donÂ’t like dark beers," but was into this one.

Pours a hazy rusty umber color with a finger of eggshell foam. Nose is pure raspberry puree, hints of vinegar, tobacco, spicy cherry, vanilla. Palate follows with nice balance of fruit, sourness and background sweetness to make it all work nicely. Bright raspberry jam, basement must wet wood lingering tobacco, vanilla, spicy leather. Solid !
Bottle at weekly tasting. Pours dark raspberry white head. Nose/taste of sour dark raspberry, chocolate, sour earth, light cherry vinegar, oak and caramel sourness. Medium body. Well balanced.
Bottle. Brown pour with tan head. Nice raspberry tart aromas other fruit jam. Nice Brett and tart raspberry flavors.

Bottle shared by Al with us brahs. Poured ruby red with small to medium khaki head. Aromas are sour raspberry, oak, vinegar, and light h blanket. Flavor was pretty dang tart with sour berries, raspberry jam, vinegar, and oak. Nice but preferred the blackberry. Tamed the acidity better. Medium body and carbonation

Bottle thanks to Will. Pours a dark ruby with small beige head that lasts leaving spotty lacing. The aroma is strong raspberry jam and oak. Thin mouthfeel with a nice jammy raspberry, light tartness, oak. Nice.

Pour out of 375 ml bottle, dark reddish brown pour with off white head, aroma brought notes of raspberry, oak, vanilla, earth, hints of dark fruit, yeast and spice notes, touch of funky notes into a bit of brett. Taste is a mix of sour cherry, raspberry, dark fruit, almost some cocoa into dark fruit, hints of oak, vanilla, earth, slight grain, finishing tart, lemony, dry.

375ml bottle in a tulip. Pours deep ruby/brown with a beige head. Aroma of raspberries, sourness / tartness, darker malts, some oak, light vanilla and spices, and some other dark fruits. Flavor the same with a nice blend. Average texture. A really good beer.

Bottle sample from "AKFaust". Colour...very cloudy, brownish-rouge with a thin white head. Nose..,quite fruity with, of course, loads of raspberry! Fairly acetic and semi dusty. Palate...dry, tannic, and briskly sweet with raspberry vinaigrette and raspberry leaf tea and bits of lemon curd. Noice!

Aroma: Tart Raspberry, Sour Mash

Appearance: Dark Purple Hue, Passes Almost No Light, White Head Ring, Some Lacing

Taste: Tart Raspberry, Cranberry

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Tart, Mildly Bitter

Bottle, 06/30/2014. Pours deep purple, light tan head fades to a haze covering the surface, thin ring of lacing. Aroma is tart, pulpy raspberries, prunes, vinegar with a touch of caramel, subtle earthy dark malts. bread, wood. Taste is tart juicy raspberry, red wine, oak. Light medium body, soft carbonation allows some of the flavors to round out a bit. Quite tasty.

Murky dark blood red appearance. No head. Nose is 100% raspberry. Just bursting with juiciness. Pretty good mouthfeel. A little oily. Far more sour than base origins. Raspberry is great. Way better than the cherry version. Acidity is quite high. Very nice.
At Avery Sour Fest Â’14. Dark burgundy red. Nice tart raspberry nose. Dry raspberry and some cobwebs. Tart.

Bottle at home with friends, courtesy of Scott. Thanks Man!! Pour is murky brown with a small white head that quickly dissipated. Cheesy, waxy, caramel corn, bready, perfume, and husky aroma. Taste is red wine vinegar, caramel, leather, cheesey, somewhat tangy, vanilla, lemon peel, lactic, bread and raspberry with a semi-sour finish. Slick mouthfeel soft carbonation. Not their best offering.

Bottle @ Steve_0. Thanks Scott. Dark orangish brown, hazy appearance with a tiny tan head. Thick goopy, big raspberry, tangy, herbal aroma. Carbonation is a bit dull. Lots of raspberries, cola, tart fruity flavor with some tannins. Pretty tasty.
